newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Indonesia Balongan crude unit resume operations.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia Balongan crude unit resume operations.

text.p: Indonesia's state-owned oil company Pertamina resumed operations at its Balongan crude distillation unit (CDU) on October 25 following scheduled maintenance since October 1, a refinery source said on Monday.
The 125,000 barrels per day (bpd) crude unit is being reconfigured to produce more than design capacity, he said.
However, two of Balongan's secondary processing units remained shut for maintenance.
An 83,000-bpd long residue catalytic cracking unit was shut October 1 for 60 days, while a 58,000-bpd atmospheric residue cracking unit was shut at the same time for 40 days.
This is the first major shutdown at the refinery in West Java since it started operations in 1994.

Indonesia has been buying more diesel and jet-kerosene fuel on the spot market as a result of maintenance at the Balongan refinery and an earlier shutdown of a 200,000-bpd crude unit at Cilacap refinery between early September and early October.
Traders said Indonesia purchased between five and six million barrels of diesel and between 1.5 and 2.0 million barrels of jet-kerosene fuel for November deliveries.
The country's normal monthly diesel imports are around 2.0 million barrels and up to 1.0 million barrels of jet-kerosene fuel.
The refinery, which is located 195 km east of Jakarta, processes 80 percent of Duri crude and 20 percent of Minas.
